Extra tiles will help solidify the game world, and make i more believable. This lecture shows how you can do it, and what problems you'll face, and, obviously, how to solve them!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:16:"decorative-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570314;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"16.DecorativeTiles.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:12:52Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:73;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:42;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297210;s:5:"title";s:20:"Creating a pine tree";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:43:51Z";s:11:"description";s:132:"

Since the world right now is only made up with terrain, its time to add some additional elements for decoration and scale.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"creating-a-pine-tree";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570678;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:15:"17.PineTree.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:56:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:72;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:43;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297214;s:5:"title";s:24:"Reworking the background";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:43:56Z";s:11:"description";s:114:"

Its time to turn our attention to the background, and make sure that it also follows the rules of tiles.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"reworking-the-background";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570684;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"18.FixingBackground.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:57:40Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:71;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:44;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161622;s:5:"title";s:25:"Exercise - Building walls";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T18:03:33Z";s:11:"description";s:120:"

Imagine your side scrolling game is set in a metropolis. see how little tiles you need to make a big building.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:23:"exercise-building-walls";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3602140;s:10:"asset_type";s:6:"E-Book";s:5:"title";s:17:"tilesExercise.pdf";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T18:04:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:70;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:45;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2385790;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 5";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:29:27Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-5";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2671122;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section5.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:56:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:69;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:46;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:605970;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:21Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:68;s:5:"title";s:20:"Creating a character";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:47;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297328;s:5:"title";s:17:"Creating the head";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:33Z";s:11:"description";s:239:"

With out mockup now ready, we can start working on our character. There are a lot of considerations to take into account. We start by just creating the head, and with that we define the size, color, age, and sex of our character.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"creating-the-head";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570744;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"19.CreatingtheHEad.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:24:16Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:67;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:48;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297330;s:5:"title";s:17:"Creating the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:38Z";s:11:"description";s:175:"

While the head provides with the identity of the character, the body provides with an attitude. Pose and shape will help convey a personality for out game character.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"creating-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570740;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"20.CreatingtheBody.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:21:43Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:66;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:49;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297332;s:5:"title";s:18:"Detailing the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:09:02Z";s:11:"description";s:202:"

Once we are happy with a body shape, we need to make it as interesting, easy to read and as recognizable as possible. For this we use shading techniques to help give a sense of depth and scale

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"detailing-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570734;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"21.DetailingtheBody.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:19:17Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:65;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:50;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297378;s:5:"title";s:17:"Adding an outline";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:26:36Z";s:11:"description";s:248:"

Just like we did with the apple and sword, we will also now use the same outlinning technique to help our character stand out. But while doing this, we must understand that it will have consequences in out workflow in the future.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"adding-an-outline";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570764;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"22.AddingAnOutline.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:30:02Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:64;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:51;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2386076;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 6";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:48:55Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-6";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2671112;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section6.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:56:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:63;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:52;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:616778;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:12:37Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:62;s:5:"title";s:9:"Animation";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:53;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2353316;s:5:"title";s:33:"The tools and basics of animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:26:51Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"the-tools-and-basics-of-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2634016;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"22-5.Basics of animation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:36:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:61;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:54;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2341828;s:5:"title";s:31:"Creating the base for animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:12:47Z";s:11:"description";s:225:"

Now is the time to take our character from a mockup into a living thing. We do this with animation. Its no the most simple thing, but it is a key aspect of suggesting that the character is alive and ready for action

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:31:"creating-the-base-for-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2620654;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:32:"23.CreatingIdleAnimationBase.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:24:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:60;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:55;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2341830;s:5:"title";s:58:"Breathing life into the character with secondary animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:13:05Z";s:11:"description";s:266:"

Simple as it may be, we need to add more detail to out animation, for it to read well, and look more alive. In this lecture we go into the issue of secondary animation and how we can make something look more organic rather than stiff and robotic.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:58:"breathing-life-into-the-character-with-secondary-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2620640;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:36:"24.BreathingLifeIntoTheCharacter.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:23:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:59;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:56;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2346784;s:5:"title";s:21:"Animating a run cycle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T12:26:11Z";s:11:"description";s:216:"

Running animation is one of the most important to learn and master. They convey weight, speed and agilty. But before you can do one on the go, we first should learn how to plot and plan a running animation.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:21:"animating-a-run-cycle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2626938;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"25.RunningAnimation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T12:33:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:58;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:57;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2347006;s:5:"title";s:24:"Completing the run cycle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T13:37:37Z";s:11:"description";s:157:"

With out animation planned out all we need now is to go in an fill the gaps. It takes time, but is so much faster once we have everything in place.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"completing-the-run-cycle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2627220;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:27:"26.RunAnimationComplete.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T13:40:50Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:57;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:58;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2353298;s:5:"title";s:19:"Animating an attack";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:26:12Z";s:11:"description";s:265:"

Idle and running so far were animations with continuous frame rate. Each frame was on the screen the same time as the others. In this attack animation we see how we can make a frame be faster or stay longer on the screen, to change the animation dynamics.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"animating-an-attack";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2634004;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"27.AttackAnimation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:33:37Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:56;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:59;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161588;s:5:"title";s:20:"Exercise - Character";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:58:56Z";s:11:"description";s:200:"

This exercise was designed to let you not only practice your character drawing skills, but also develop the capacity to interpret a concept design, and try and translate that into pixel art.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"exercise-character";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3602122;s:10:"asset_type";s:6:"E-Book";s:5:"title";s:21:"characterExercise.pdf";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:59:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:55;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:60;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2386078;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 7";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:49:00Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-7";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2671510;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section7.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T20:35:25Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:54;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:61;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:618090;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T09:42:14Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:53;s:5:"title";s:32:"Bonus Round - Importing to unity";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:62;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2353314;s:5:"title";s:28:"Importing sprites into unity";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:26:38Z";s:11:"description";s:189:"

In this lecture you'll learn how to save one image with all your frames, and how you import that image into unity and configure it for use in a video game situation.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:28:"importing-sprites-into-unity";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2678256;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:20:"exportingtounity.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-10T18:18:47Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:52;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:63;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2354326;s:5:"title";s:34:"Recreating the animations in unity";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T13:32:35Z";s:11:"description";s:113:"

In this lecture we look into the animation panel in unity to rebuild our animations to work with unity.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"recreating-the-animations-in-unity";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2635346;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:37:"29.CreatingTheCharacterAnimations.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T13:37:40Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:51;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:64;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2354554;s:5:"title";s:39:"Making it interactive with free scripts";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T14:09:11Z";s:11:"description";s:276:"

Now that we have all our animations we can turn the player into a movable character with a couple of free scripts and some layer fiddling around. Find the attached resources to get the scripts and character sprite or follow the instructions on the lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:39:"making-it-interactive-with-free-scripts";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2635576;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:33:"30.UsingScriptsforInteraction.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T14:14:53Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:50;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:65;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:658688;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:35:24Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:48;s:5:"title";s:12:"TopDownTiles";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:66;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511204;s:5:"title";s:27:"What is topdown perspective";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:35:37Z";s:11:"description";s:236:"

Before creating terrain tiles, we need to understand what the "game camera" is meant to see and show to the player or user. So in this lecture we'll look at a 3d model and see how a topdown perspective is built.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"what-is-topdown-perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818400;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:25:"31.TopDownPerspective.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:45:58Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:47;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:67;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511206;s:5:"title";s:29:"Different types of techniques";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:35:56Z";s:11:"description";s:216:"

Even though its hard to find names to call these different techniques of creating and using terrain tiles, I've created a selection of the four I feel are the most important and most used in pixel art.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:29:"different-types-of-techniques";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818384;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:17:"32.Techniques.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:42:47Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:46;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:68;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511208;s:5:"title";s:43:"Creating Path Tiles - Setting up the pieces";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:36:33Z";s:11:"description";s:228:"

Creating tiles can be intimidating if you think about the amount of variations you have to make. So we start with the most straigh forward one: Path Tiles. We'll create a fundation for all the tile pieces we need.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:41:"creating-path-tiles-setting-up-the-pieces";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818402;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"33.PathTiles_Part1.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:46:31Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:45;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:69;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511210;s:5:"title";s:47:"Creating Path Tiles - Creating a usable pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:36:56Z";s:11:"description";s:187:"

With the most basic pieces created, we now have enough material to create the next pieces with ease, by just reusing parts. We do this to create the base pattern for out tileset

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:45:"creating-path-tiles-creating-a-usable-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818410;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"34.PathTiles_Part2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:48:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:44;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:70;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511212;s:5:"title";s:49:"Creating Path Tiles - Adding Shading to the tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:37:16Z";s:11:"description";s:192:"

The main pattern is done, the road is very evident on the screen, but we can still add a little depth. We'll do that by creating a sense of relief on the road and grass

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:47:"creating-path-tiles-adding-shading-to-the-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818430;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"35.PathShading.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:53:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:43;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:71;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511214;s:5:"title";s:42:"Creating Path Tiles - Trying out the tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:37:37Z";s:11:"description";s:138:"

Now that it's complete, lets take it for a spin, and see how it behaves. We'll build road using the tiles we created.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:40:"creating-path-tiles-trying-out-the-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818426;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"36.TryingOuttheTiles.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:52:28Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:42;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:72;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512674;s:5:"title";s:39:"Patch Tiles - Understanding the pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:34:30Z";s:11:"description";s:205:"

In this lecture, we'll look at how complicated the patch tiles pattern can be. We'll see how its used, and find a solution for a much simpler pattern that will do the same job

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"patch-tiles-understanding-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846276;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"36.PatchTilesPattern.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T11:12:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:41;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:73;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512632;s:5:"title";s:39:"PatchTiles - Creating a base grass tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:29:39Z";s:11:"description";s:134:"

Before we do our patch tile set we want to create some base tiles for use later on. We start by making a standard grass tile

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"patchtiles-creating-a-base-grass-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846226;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:16:"37.GrassTile.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T10:59:04Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:40;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:74;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512640;s:5:"title";s:38:"Patch Tiles - Improving the grass tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:30:02Z";s:11:"description";s:147:"

After we got a base grass tile laid down, we want to improve on its look so that it breaks the grid effect and looks like grass

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"patch-tiles-improving-the-grass-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846228;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"38.GrassBasePart2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T10:59:42Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:39;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:75;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512650;s:5:"title";s:36:"Patch Tiles - Creating the dirt tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:30:30Z";s:11:"description";s:130:"

To go with the grass tile, we'll create a dirt tile as well, that we'll later use to make all the transitions

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"patch-tiles-creating-the-dirt-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846224;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:15:"39.DirtTile.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T10:57:23Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:38;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:76;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512672;s:5:"title";s:34:"Patch Tiles - Creating the pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:34:08Z";s:11:"description";s:133:"

With our base tiles created we can go ahead and start putting a pattern together so that we can build our tile set

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"patch-tiles-creating-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846278;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"40.MakingTheTiles.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T11:13:26Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:37;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:77;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541580;s:5:"title";s:27:"BlockTiles - The cliff side";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:10:50Z";s:11:"description";s:240:"

Elevation is one of the main features of the block tile technique, so lets take advantage of that. Since we already have a grass texture and a dirt texture, all we need now is a cliff side texture to use as an elevation indicator.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"blocktiles-the-cliff-side";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856090;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"41.BlockTilesCliff.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:21:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:36;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:78;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541594;s:5:"title";s:38:"Block Tiles - Creating the transitions";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:14Z";s:11:"description";s:181:"

With the cliff tile created, we need not to make transitions from the grass tile to the edges of the cliff side. One those are made we can more effectively suggest height.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"block-tiles-creating-the-transitions";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856100;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"42.BlockTilesTransitions.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:26:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:35;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:79;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541602;s:5:"title";s:29:"Block Tiles - adding a shadow";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:24Z";s:11:"description";s:179:"

To further increase the effect oh height the ideal is to add a shadow to the tile set. in this lecture we go about doing that and what tricks you can use to achieve that

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"block-tiles-adding-a-shadow";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856096;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"43.BlockTilesShadow.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:25:11Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:34;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:80;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541604;s:5:"title";s:36:"Block Tiles - Trying out the pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:37Z";s:11:"description";s:105:"

With the small pattern complete, we can take the tileset for a spinn and see how it looks like.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"block-tiles-trying-out-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856106;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"44.BlockTilesTrying.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:27:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:33;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:81;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161582;s:5:"title";s:24:"Exercise - River Pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:57:39Z";s:11:"description";s:128:"

With a grass tile and a cliff/dirt tile, it is fairly easy to create now a river pattern to add to the world.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"exercise-river-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3602114;s:10:"asset_type";s:6:"E-Book";s:5:"title";s:20:"pathTileExercise.pdf";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:57:57Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:32;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:82;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1421092;s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:48:57Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:31;s:5:"title";s:23:"Top-Down RPG Characters";s:11:"description";s:119:"The goal of this section is to show effective methods in creating characters for rpg type games in top-down perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:83;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676614;s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:05Z";s:11:"description";s:41:"

Short introduction to the section.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:12:"introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6731306;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:9:"Intro.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-05T18:17:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:30;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:84;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676616;s:5:"title";s:21:"Design considerations";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:15Z";s:11:"description";s:184:"

In this first lecture we have a look at the considerations to have when designing a character for a top down perspective, especially if its going to be viewed in a small area.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:21:"design-considerations";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725158;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"01.ConceptToPixel.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:59:46Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:29;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:85;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676618;s:5:"title";s:19:"Basic Shapes Method";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:24Z";s:11:"description";s:262:"

In this size of characters, the line art process can clutter the sprite. So most of the time, its better to avoid tracing over a complex drawing and instead define solid shapes.
Solid shapes provide a quick understanding of the model and its parts.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"basic-shapes-method";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725194;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"02.BasicShapes.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:06:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:28;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:86;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676620;s:5:"title";s:18:"Shading Principles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:31Z";s:11:"description";s:198:"

This lecture focuses on explaining the shading method and the facial features.
Before we move on to shading the body, we get a notion of the reasons behind the type of shading methods.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"shading-principles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725204;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"03.ShadingPrinciples.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:08:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:27;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:87;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676624;s:5:"title";s:16:"Shading the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:41Z";s:11:"description";s:183:"

In this lecture we go ahead and create more colors to shade the body completely. We use techniques such as cast shadows and outlining to give form to what was only flat shapes.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:16:"shading-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725248;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"04.ShadingTheBody.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:21:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:26;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:88;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676626;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating and shading the side view";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:47Z";s:11:"description";s:86:"

From the front view we create the side view and shade it using the same colors.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"creating-and-shading-the-side-view";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725622;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"05.ShadingSide.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T22:22:49Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:25;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:89;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676628;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating and shading the back view";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:05Z";s:11:"description";s:149:"

Creating the back view for the character is a matter of editing the front view and make sure the elements of the body are kept in perspective.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"creating-and-shading-the-back-view";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725298;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"06.ShadingTheBack.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:32:33Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:24;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:90;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676630;s:5:"title";s:25:"Front view walk animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:14Z";s:11:"description";s:150:"

A simple 4 frame walk animation can be made just from moving the legs, but we add more detail to the whole body to really improve the animation

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"front-view-walk-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725318;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"07.AnimateAFrontWalk.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:35:39Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:23;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:91;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676632;s:5:"title";s:24:"Side View walk animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:19Z";s:11:"description";s:152:"

The side view is the easiest to animate, as the feet are very visible to the game camera. Still, we must worry about the perspective they are in.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"side-view-walk-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725454;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"08.AnimateSideWalk.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T21:04:32Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:22;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:92;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676636;s:5:"title";s:33:"Complete animations demonstration";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:47Z";s:11:"description";s:135:"

After adding back a few details here and there, this lecture serves as a demonstration of what can be done with a few additions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"complete-animations-demonstration";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725434;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"09.FinalAnimations.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:59:42Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:21;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:93;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:770930;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:27:53Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:20;s:5:"title";s:13:"Student Edits";s:11:"description";s:150:"This section will host video lectures of me doing edits on some of the work that student's post. The purpose is to show how you can improve your work.";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:94;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2944312;s:5:"title";s:29:"Alan Pauley - Chalice shading";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:28:46Z";s:11:"description";s:117:"

In this lecture, I take Alan's work and paint over it to explain my suggestions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"alan-pauley-chalice-shading";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3343776;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"AlanEdit.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:35:10Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:19;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:95;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2989704;s:5:"title";s:31:"Jason Brennan - Fish and candle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-26T21:23:29Z";s:11:"description";s:233:"

This lecture is an edit to the original artwork of Jason Brennan. He chose some very hard subjects to do in pixel art so the lecture is more about fixing what's done rather than showing a different aproach

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:29:"jason-brennan-fish-and-candle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3399140;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"JasonEdit.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-26T21:27:52Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:18;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:96;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:793732;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:13:41Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:17;s:5:"title";s:19:"Isometric pixel art";s:11:"description";s:89:"This section focus on creating pixel art while in the constrains of isometric perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:97;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035532;s:5:"title";s:35:"Understanding isometric perspective";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:14:03Z";s:11:"description";s:229:"

Isometric perspective is based on keeping the same dimensions in all 3 axis. This has its advantages and disadvantages. In this lecture we look at some of the specifications when drawing images in isometric perspective.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:35:"understanding-isometric-perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453962;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"lecture1.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:27:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:16;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035538;s:5:"title";s:26:"Creating an isometric grid";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:14:24Z";s:11:"description";s:382:"

If you are going to create an isometric world, you need to get yourself an isometric grid. This will help you line everything up, making sure parts fit into each other and that you always have a good reference of where your lines should be. On the resources you'll find the base for the isometric tile, if you don't want to create a base tile yourself.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"creating-an-isometric-grid";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453954;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"lecture2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:26:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:15;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:99;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035552;s:5:"title";s:44:"Construction lines for an isometric building";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:16:47Z";s:11:"description";s:221:"

In this lecture we start our isometric project: A tower with barracs. We first define the scale, position and shape of our building and place down some construction lines for what we will be creating afterwards.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:44:"construction-lines-for-an-isometric-building";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453964;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"Lecture3.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:27:43Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:14;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}}}

item.title: Landing Page Design & Conversion Rate Optimization 2018
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
**Brand New For 2018 - TheBestselling Landing PageDesign Course on Udemy**

Join over 96,000 of your fellowwebsite owners, online marketers and entrepreneursin learning the fundamentals landing page design and conversion rate optimization.

I will walk you through every step of landing page design with real life case studies, actual experiments and tons of examples from around the web. By the end of this course, you'll be able to design landing pages that converts 2X - 5X more than your current landing pages.

**Disclaimer**
This is not a web development course. This course will not teach you CSS, HTML or JavaScript. This course will teach you the fundamental psychological principles of good landing page design, and it will help you understand the buyer's journey so you can design landing pages that convert better. I will also be teaching you how to test your designs so you can design final landing pages that will convert 20-30%more than your current website and landing pages.

Good landing page design isn't just a nice thing to know it's absolutely essential to the success of your online business. Whether you're in lead-gen, ecommerce or consulting, effective and clear landing page design can spell the difference between a positive and negative ROI.

A report released by Adobe and eMarketer revealed that companies spend doubleon traffic acquisition than they do on conversion rate optimization and implementing better landing page design. That's a huge mistake and you're leaving a lot of money on the table.

What's the point of buying traffic to your site if you don't put in the effort to understand how to convert it?

In this landing page design course you will learn:

  • How to implement persuasion frameworks like scarcity, reciprocal concessions and cognitive dissonance theory in your landing page design

  • How to write headlines and calls to action that will motivate your users to act instead of turning them off

  • How to design an action block with a clearly defined conversion goal

  • How to triple your conversion rates by using the principles of readability, simplicity, perceived value and clarity in your landing page design

  • How to run professional usability tests on a tight budget

  • How to build a landing page from scratch on a custom domain without writing a single line of code

  • The Fogg Behavior Model and how it applies to good landing page design

  • Why understanding the AIDAsales funnel is so important in conversion rate optimization

... and much, much more!

For the price of dinner out with your friends, you have the power to transform your landing page into a sales machine. I guarantee you there are significant issues with your landing page design that are causing visitors to leave when they would have converted. You're leaving money on the table.

If you think this stuff is complicated, it's not.

If you think landing page design stuff is expensive, it's not.

If you think conversion rate optimization is time consuming, it's not.

If you think watching this course won't make a different to your bottom line ... think again.

I've consulted with hundreds of companies around the world and have redesigned websites for publicly traded companies and businesses generating over 1 Billion dollars annually. Trust me, Ilearned all this the hard way.

This is the course on landing page design I wish Ihad when I was first starting out!

Enroll today and enjoy:

  • Lifetime access to the course and all future updates

  • Over 10 hours of high quality, up to date video lectures

  • Exercises and feedback

  • Access to the student-only discussion forum

  • 30 day, no questions asked, money back guarantee

  • Over 11,000 studnets enrolled

  • 4.8 average student rating

Thanks again for checking out my course and I look forward to seeing you in the classroom :)

Calls to action are the most important design element on your landing pages. In this lecture you will learn:

  • How to design high converting CTA's
  • How to use your headline to support your conversion action
  • How to write copy for your calls to action
  • Using graphics and visuals to support your calls to action
  • Setting post click expectations so visitors feel safe converting on your landing pages
  • Removing visual distractions from around your conversion block
  • How to design buttons so visitors know they're clickable right away
  • Lecture Exercise: Finding ways to improve your CTA's using the principles discussed in this lectures
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:73:"the-art-and-science-behind-designing-high-converting-calls-to-action-ctas";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7431912;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"2.4 Final.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-22T02:36:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:37;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:19;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6241184;s:5:"title";s:52:"Readability and Visual Hierarchy Landing Page Design";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-22T06:17:05Z";s:11:"description";s:822:"

Readability is a well known concept in general, but it's not used enough in landing page design best practices. In this lecture you will learn:

  • How we people read on the web
  • How to format your text for scanning
  • How your visitors perceive your website or landing page copy
  • How to create effective visual hierarchies
  • The best way to write paragraphs
  • The importance of objectivity and removing unnecessary jargon from your copy
  • How to format your heading for maximum readability
  • How to create a sense of consistency with your text formatting
  • Examples of distinctive style and aesthetics while still remaining readable
  • Lecture Exercise: Rewriting your homepage copy using half the words you currently have

Conventions on the web are very important to know and respect. Conventions are formed based on years and thousands of hours of web browsing and people expect things to work in a certain way.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • Why conventions are so important
  • Rules for defying a convention
  • Conventions in landing page design like logo, site ID and navigational structure
  • Header and footer conventions
  • Conventions for ads on your site, headers and other elements on your landing pages
  • Research that has shown conventions to be essential to good user experience
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:49:"respecting-web-conventions-in-landing-page-design";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7439480;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"2.6 Final.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-23T01:34:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:35;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:21;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6246234;s:5:"title";s:76:"Using Videos, Graphics and Imagery to Increase Landing Page Conversion Rates";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-23T01:29:28Z";s:11:"description";s:1006:"

Every good landing page and website uses images, graphics, iconography and / or video to enhance the visual appeal of their landing page or to help convey their message.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • The important role images play in giving your visitors a great first impression
  • How to use images and graphics to tell a story
  • The importance of evoking emotion with your visual components
  • How to find and use high quality stock photography when you don't have custom imagery available
  • When your images and graphics will hurt rather than improve your conversion rate
  • Landing page design best practices for using images and graphics
  • Design trends for background images
  • How to use icons and thumbnails to break up copy and give your pages more flow and breathability
  • Examples of good (and bad) use of graphics from around the web
  • How to use videos to increase conversion rate on your landing pages
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:75:"using-videos-graphics-and-imagery-to-increase-landing-page-conversion-rates";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7439476;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"2.7 Final.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-23T01:34:46Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:34;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:22;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6247084;s:5:"title";s:79:"Information Architecture and Accessibility - Landing Page Design Best Practices";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-23T07:18:34Z";s:11:"description";s:968:"

Information architecture and accessibility are two important concepts in making your landing pages more enjoyable to use by your visitors.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • How to organize your content effectively on your landing page
  • Make sure the right information appears above the fold
  • How to assess the ease-of-use of your navigation
  • The importance of giving the user feedback on elements that should be giving feedback
  • Breaking down the elements of a web page into components like Site ID, Primary Nav, Site Search, Utilities, Breadcrumbs, Page Title, Product Filters and Footer Navigation
  • How to give your users a sense of orientation and direction
  • Contrast with your color scheme
  • Tips on choosing the right font and font size for your demographics
  • Tips for formatting your text for maximum legibility
  • Lecture Exercise: Steve Krugs Trunk Test
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:77:"information-architecture-and-accessibility-landing-page-design-best-practices";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7441038;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:7:"2.8.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-23T07:24:29Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:33;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:23;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6263068;s:5:"title";s:73:"Trust, Safety and Credibility (Part 1) Landing Page Design Best Practices";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-26T17:40:52Z";s:11:"description";s:877:"

A users likelihood to convert on your landing page is directly related to the sense of security and trust your landing page conveys when a person first lands on your site.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • Concepts of neatness, organization and high production quality in landing page design
  • Real world preference tests on three different designs in the auto industry with different levels of overall production quality
  • How to provide transactional assurances that will counteract the anxieties your visitors have
  • How to use satisfaction guarantees and company policies to increase trust and security
  • Using logos, media mentions and badges properly in your landing page designs
  • Understanding social identity and customer reviews to your advantage
  • Landing page design best practices in the real world

In this section we will continue to talk about how to use testimonials, reviews and client logos to increase a sense of trust on your landing pages. We will also take a look at a number of real-life examples of good and page landing page design from real life websites.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:70:"trust-safety-and-credibility-part-2-landing-page-design-best-practices";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7456670;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:9:"2.9.2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-26T17:45:23Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:31;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:25;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6264586;s:5:"title";s:53:"Dedicated Landing Page Design Best Practices (Part 1)";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-26T21:56:11Z";s:11:"description";s:518:"

Dedicated landing pages are used to highlight specific products or services, and they are used to accept traffic from individual ppc campaigns.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • Landing page design best practices for the dedicated landing page
  • The importance of a clear headline and clear call to action
  • Breaking down a landing page step by step and pointing out all the areas that can be improved upon
  • Real life examples from PPC landing pages across the internet

Scarcity is an important psychological concept in landing page design and you can use it effectively in your landing pages to improve your conversion rate

In this lecture you will learn:

  • How to create a sense of urgency with scarcity
  • How to use deadlines in landing page design for seasonal products
  • Examples of scarcity in web design
  • How to be specific and valuable
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:64:"using-scarcity-to-improve-conversion-rates-on-your-landing-pages";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7459682;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"3.1 Final.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-27T03:29:26Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:26;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:30;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6276264;s:5:"title";s:79:"Principles of Persuasion: Reciprocal Concessions & Reciprocity in Landing Pages";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-28T23:07:44Z";s:11:"description";s:621:"

The principles of reciprocity and reciprocal concessions can be found all over the web in landing page design. They are two very important concepts worth considering when writing copy for your landing pages.

In this lecture you will learn:

  • How to engender a sense of gratitude and indebtedness in your website visitors
  • How to apply negotiating principles and techniques in your landing page design
  • Different ideas for implementing reciprocity in any business model
  • Using reciprocal concessions in conjunction with other landing page persuasion concepts


";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:76:"principles-of-persuasion-reciprocal-concessions-reciprocity-in-landing-pages";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7471930;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:7:"3.2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-28T23:10:49Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:25;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:31;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6276298;s:5:"title";s:67:"Principles of Persuasion: Anchoring and Cognitive Dissonance Theory";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-28T23:16:33Z";s:11:"description";s:501:"

When it comes to pricing your products and services, anchoring and cognitive dissonance theory are two very powerful persuasion frameworks that can increase your conversion rates.

  • Real life example of an anchoring test
  • Examples of persuasion frameworks being used effectively on landing pages throughout the web
  • How people rationalize their decisions based on their previous efforts
  • How to win more clients by understanding cognitive dissonance theory
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:66:"principles-of-persuasion-anchoring-and-cognitive-dissonance-theory";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7472000;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"3.3 Final.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-28T23:21:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:24;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:32;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6277464;s:5:"title";s:63:"User Scenarios and Contextual Perception in Landing Page Design";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-12-29T04:34:18Z";s:11:"description";s:952:"

In this lecture you will learn:

  • The power of empathy in landing page design
  • How your visitors differ from each other and how your website visitors will typically feel about your products and services differently then how you think they do
  • Understanding the importance of contextual awareness
  • How to think about your website visitors in the greater picture: Where they came from, what they want and what their motivations are
  • Using analytics tools to understand where your website visitors came from and what their demographics are
  • Understanding the difference between organic, PPC, social and email traffic
  • How to build user scenarios to get an intuitive feel for your visitors
  • Building personas to understand the knowledge your visitors have and what their anxieties are
  • How to build complex and complete user scenarios
  • Lecture exercise
